subject: p16855430
History: -year-old woman with COPD and CHF in extremis.
Impression: AP chest compared to through : Pulmonary edema had improved substantially between and, but there is substantially worse consolidation in the right lower and left upper lobes today than on. Whether this is recurrence of pulmonary edema or concurrent pneumonia is radiographically indeterminate. At least small bilateral pleural effusion is presumed. Moderate-to-severe cardiomegaly is longstanding. Left PIC line ends in the upper SVC. Findings were discussed by telephone with Dr. At 12:45 pm.
